0.user_question: Tom has 4 bedrooms in his house.  They measure 20 by 12 feet each.  The living room is 5 times bigger than one bedroom.  The rest of the house is 1000 square feet.  What is the total area, in square feet, of the house?

1.subquestion: Firstly, what will be the area occupied by all the Bed Rooms together ?

subanswer.text: Each bedroom measures 20 x 12 sq ft = 240 square feet. Since Tom has 4 such rooms; their combined size would be 240 sq ft × 4 = 960 square feet. The answer is 960.

ost_step.1: One bedroom (of size) equates to half the entire house which means that two bedrooms equals whole house without any other space like living room or kitchen etc., so if we double it then resultant value indicates full capacity i.e.  960 sq ft X 2= 1920 sq ft . This implies our remaining calculation needs only for third party spaces(like Living Room).
ost_step.2: Tom’s four rooms sum up to about 1/3rd part when compared against their aggregate footprint. Thus ,we can easily deduce all these extra areas combined contribute another almost similar amount namely; ~(~1920 x 1 / 3)= ~640sqft. We now need to subtract this from initial mentioned figure of Total Area being measured at 1000+ Square Feet thus leaving us with ; Final Answer To Be : ~(~~640)+1000 Sq Ft.= ~1640SqFt .....[Note::We got around numbers here as actual measurements would take into account wall thicknesses along with height difference ]
